required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome of LA Versus GA for Staged CEA Prior To CABG
clinical_study.official_title: Outcome of Local Versus General Anesthetic for Staged Carotid Endarterectomy Prior To CABG, Cohort Study
clinical_study.source: National University of Ireland, Galway, Ireland

brief_summary.textblock:
A retrospective analysis of all patients that underwent carotid endarterectomy (CEA) for stenotic disease - diagnosed at pre-operative investigation - prior to CABG as staged operation within 6- months.
The rate of postoperative stroke and complications was compared between CEA performed under Local anaesthetic (LA) to those performed under General anaesthetic (GA).

detailed_description.textblock:
The primary outcome was the rate of postoperative stroke in patients that had staged CEA prior to CABG. This was defined as CEA within a period of 4 weeks prior to CABG.
We retrospectively looked at those patients that fulfilled the inclusion criteria and had CEA performed either under LA (Group A) or under GA (Group B). We measured the 30 days' postoperative stroke rate as the main outcome. We also looked at the rate of intraoperative stroke.
Additionally, we assessed the rate for developing nerve injuries and/or hematoma postoperatively. Finally, we examined the risk for developing postoperative stroke in patients with bilateral significant carotid artery disease that underwent surgery in one side.

primary_outcome.description: a transient ischaemic attack (TIA), or a disabling stroke within 30 days of the carotid endarterectomy procedure.

secondary_outcome.description: Major haematoma was defined as a significant bleeding that required the patient to go back to theatre for a secondary procedure.
A minor hematoma was defined as bleeding that resulted in bruising and neck swelling without causing significant concerns to require a secondary procedur
Either neuropraxia that resolved with time or permanent injuries that resulted in disability.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Carotid Endarterectomy under Local Anaesthetic Pre-CABG
arm_group.description: Patients that underwent carotid endarterectomy under local anaesthetic prior to coronary artery bypass operations in staged fashion within 6 months.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Carotid Endarterectomy under General Anaesthetic Pre-CABG
arm_group.description: Patients that underwent carotid endarterectomy under general anaesthetic prior to coronary artery bypass operations in staged fashion within 6 months.

intervention.description: Carotid endarterectomy prior to CABG operations either under Local Anaesthetic or under General Anaesthetic.
intervention.arm_group_label: Carotid Endarterectomy under General Anaesthetic Pre-CABG
Carotid Endarterectomy under Local Anaesthetic Pre-CABG

study_pop.textblock: In-hospital patients referred by Cardiothoracic for carotid endarterectomy prior to CABG.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients that had carotid endarterectomy performed in staged fashion within 6 months before a CABG operation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with symptomatic carotid disease

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: National University of Ireland, Galway, Ireland

patient_data.ipd_description: Hospital records not to be shared, but raw data used for statistical analysis will be shared after removing identifiers.
